THE SATURDAY EVENING POST
August 17, 1940
FLIGHT INFORMATIO
Service in the air and on the ground
HE FLAGSHIP has tripled the speed of travel. It has increased the
â€¢ convenience of travel. But it has done something more. It has cre-
ated in travel a new kind of personalized service.
First evidence that you're a welcome guest comes when you phone
for a reservation. There's somebody at the other end of the wire who
cares. When you arrive at the ticket office, you find that you're expected.
Right there you're relieved of baggage and you don't see it again until
it's delivered to you promptly at your destination.
From the moment you step into a luxurious limousine in one city
until you step out of one in another, you feel you're among friends.
Attendants, porters, stewardesses and Flying Officers go out of their
way to make you feel at ease and at home.
Thousands comment upon how infinitely simple and pleasant it is
to make a trip by air. The comfort of air travel comes principally from
the smooth flight and luxurious appointments of the modern passenger
plane. But it's the Flagship's personalized service which, as much as
anything else, makes you want to fly again!
Make your next trip by American Airlines which serves the princi-
pal cities of the nation, coast to coast. For reservations, or information
call your Travel Agent or the nearest American Airlines office.
AMERICAN AIRLINES INC

AMERICAN AIRLINES 1c.
ROUTE OF THE FLAGSHIPS
